column4: Is there a way to set the wlan0 as the primary when you have an eth0 on a different network set up?
I usually edit /etc/network/interface to take eth0 out of control of network manager (explicitely define the settings)
how do I keep my eth0 utilized and running? Do I need to activate it using ifconfig in my .profile or something?
click on NetworkManager, goto manual config, and change the ethernet interface from "roaming mode" to dhcp or static
